item.title: How Capital Starved Companies Upgrade Technology
item.description:
Even with the economy recovering, securing funds for new technology can be challenging for businesses. Instead of traditional financing, consider “hosted solutions” or renting technology. This approach avoids large capital investments, allowing businesses to upgrade their systems affordably. Website hosting is a prime example. Initially, hosting your website on your servers made sense. However, with increased competition, affordable hosting services have become widely available, making it more practical to outsource this function...

item.title: Connectivity Expansion With Multiple T1 Lines
item.description:
For many years, T1 lines have been a reliable network connection, especially when bandwidth demands are low. However, with increasing bandwidth requirements exceeding 1.5 Mbps, upgrading from the traditional T1 line becomes necessary. One solution to increase bandwidth without abandoning existing T1 lines is “bonding.” This technique combines the capacity of multiple T1 lines, effectively creating a single, faster connection. A managed router with multiple interface cards connects and manages the combined bandwidth from the T1 lines...
